DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the status of the IgG immune function level.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An immunoglobulin isotype (subclass) that characterizes secondary immune responses.  This isotype is further broken down into several smaller subclasses (IgG1, IgG2a, IgG2b, IgG3 in the mouse; IgG1-4 in the human), and each subclass is differentially synthesized and secreted into the serum upon differential immune stimuli._A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An immunoglobulin isotype (subclass) that characterizes secondary immune responses.  This isotype is further broken down into several smaller subclasses (IgG1, IgG2a, IgG2b, IgG3 in the mouse; IgG1-4 in the human), and each subclass is differentially synthesized and secreted into the serum upon differential immune stimuli.

Concepts.definition: An immunoglobulin isotype (subclass) that characterizes secondary immune responses.  This isotype is further broken down into several smaller subclasses (IgG1, IgG2a, IgG2b, IgG3 in the mouse; IgG1-4 in the human), and each subclass is differentially synthesized and secreted into the serum upon differential immune stimuli.

Property.preferredDefinition: A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.  (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.: A number with no fractional part.::10%: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
